page.title: 10Newcomer to Hanley Swan
page.content: Mr Norris wanted to live in the country but close to a school for his children, and with good communications for his business. He lives in a large house part of which he uses for his business. Today many small companies are run from homes, like his computer company. Visiting people can find Hanley Swan easily,it's on a B road and only a few turnings from the motorway. A disadvantage is it has no regular bus service to connect with the nearest town railway. The Postal service is adequate, and having a village P.O.he can make use of its banking facilities. Local carrier firms are vital to him in transporting his computers. His family enjoy living in Hanley Swan, because they can go for country walks, join in horse riding and reach other activities they like.
